handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Weaver of tales. With their magical melodies, Bards are the heart and soul of every adventure. While wizards use hard-won knowledge and Druids use the power of nature, Bard's channel the power of pure charisma to author the world around them. Bards take the roll of support caster, shaking the resolve of enemies and shaping the face of the battlefield. Many bards are the face of their adventuring party, using their wit and tact to expertly navigate social situations.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: A bard's magic can be invaluable when adventuring. Spells like Conjure Illusion and Disguise, and Trick up Your Sleeve can help a party get out of sticky situations, while Song of Healing can keep party members on their feet in combat. Bards leave feats of strength to the martial classes, but it is not out of the ordinary for a highly dextrous bard to sneak into danger alongside the party rogue.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Bards shine in social situations, where their high charisma and arsenal of spells such as Suggestion and Modify Memory help them glean information and escape social traps. Some bards travel town to town and leave a string of heartbroken lovers in their wake, while others climb to the highest echelons of society.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Bards are capable support casters. Spells like Slow and Racous Laughter allow them to weaken their enemies, while Haste empowers their allies. They also make adept healers, casting spells like Song of Healing and Song of Mass Healing. While their damage output may not match wizards or warlocks, spells like Biting Words and Power Chord are still formidable, and the Bard's versitility is second to none.

Tier_1.name: Power Chord
Tier_1.description: A pulse of sonic energy streaks from you in all directions. The wall of force parts around your allies and strikes your foes.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against the Resistance of any creature hit by the spell. On success, they are pushed back fifteen feet and Staggered.

Tier_1.name: Biting Words
Tier_1.description: As you utter an magical insult, a set of ethereal teeth appear beside your enemy and attempt to bite them.
Tier_1.upcast: For every action point spent on this spell, increase its range by 60ft.

effect.description: If you roll max damage for this attack, your target is Grappled. You must use concentration to maintain this grapple. Damage is repeated at the end of each of the target's turns until the grapple ends.

Tier_1.name: Blocking Hand
Tier_1.description: As an enemy attacks, summon an unseen force of protection as a reaction. Make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, their attack misses. On failure, it deals half damage.

Tier_1.name: Song of Healing
Tier_1.description: Your voice fills the air in a soothing melody, and a gentle wave of magic washes over your target. Their wounds slowly start to heal over, and their vitality is restored.

Tier_1.name: Distract
Tier_1.description: Use your magic to project your voice into an enemy's ears.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are Distracted.

Tier_1.name: Slow
Tier_1.description: Your next word comes slowly as though stretched over time. Like honey, it drips over your target.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are Slowed.
effect.save: You must repeat your check at the end of each of your turns, or every five minutes when out of combat.

Tier_1.name: Raucous Laughter
Tier_1.description: You fire off a quip or joke laced with magic power.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they fall to the ground in laughter and be Incapacitated.
effect.save: You must repeat your check at the end of each of your turns or or every minute when out of combat. The effect ends instantly if they are injured.

Tier_1.name: Trick up Your Sleeve
Tier_1.description: Your sleeve contains a small pocket dimension, capable of holding up to one cubic foot of material. Once you've hidden something up your sleeve, only you may retrieve it. If you fall unconcious or die, anything hidden in your sleeve instantly pops out.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend an action point on this spell to summon up to one hundred feet of tied together cloths from your sleeve. The cloths are bound tightly enough that they are may be treated as rope.

Tier_1.name: Suggestion
Tier_1.description: Your honeyed words are laced with irresistible magic as you speak earnestly to your target. Make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they believe the next ten words that leave your mouth. They are able to reassess their feelings if they are presented with facts to the contrary. In such a case, You must repeat your check at disadvantage.

Tier_1.name: Conjure Illusion
Tier_1.description: At the wave of your hand, the air shimmers and a magical mirage appears. You are able to conjure a static illusory image of the size of a horse or smaller. To all those who see it, the object appears to be present, though upon further inspection it is ethereal.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to create a programmed illusion which has both weight and texture, and which can be capable of movement and speech. When you create such an illusion, you may establish up to five responses that it is capable of making. You must give it a script and directions regarding how and where it should move. The programmed illusion is not sentient, and cannot make decisions for itself.

Tier_2.name: Kilgore's Thunderous Shout
Tier_2.description: Sucking in a breath, you channel the fearsome energy of Kilgore, barbarian minstrel of the realm of cheese and mead. The shout that you release is mighty and wounds all enemies in a cone before you.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, enemies suffer an additional 1d6 damage and are pushed back 10 feet further.

effect.description: For targets that are large or smaller, make an inner fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are thrown back 15 feet and be knocked prone.

Tier_2.name: Song of Mass Healing
Tier_2.description: Your voice swells with divine resonance. At the sound, your allies' wounds begin to knit themselves shut.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, heal your allies for an additional dice of damage or increase the radius by 30 feet

Tier_2.name: Counter Magic
Tier_2.description: As an enemy attempts to cast a spell, use your power to disrupt them. If the enemy is a minion, the spell is instantly dispelled. Otherwise, make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, the spell is blocked. This spell does not affect natural abilities such as a dragon's fire breath.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to make your check with advantage, or two more to cause it to work without a check.

Tier_2.name: Modify Memory
Tier_2.description: Tapping into your magic, you tell a compelling lie.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against your target's Resistance. On success, modify a memory of your choosing. The target tries to rationalize the modified memory within reason, but will realize what happened if provided with adequate proof.

Tier_2.name: Haste
Tier_2.description: Your voice rises in a quickening tempo as you urge your target forward.

effect.description: Blood pounds in their ears as they are filled with incredible energy. For the spell's duration, they are affected by the Hastened condition.

Tier_2.name: Disguise
Tier_2.description: With a whispered incantation, you cloak your true form in a shimmering veil of illusion so that you look like someone else. You must appear humanoid and be within one foot of your current height. Your disguise can include a new wardrobe. Magical alterations are ethereal and do not hold up to physical inspection.

Tier_2.name: Invisible Servant
Tier_2.description: With a snap of your fingers, you summon an invisible servant to aid you. The servant has no mind of its own, but is instead a manifestation of you will, and follows your orders to the letter. Invisible servants are of little use in combat. As an action, you may have your invisible servant attempt to grapple someone.

Tier_2.name: Minor Gate
Tier_2.description: With a sound like a rush of wind, you tear open a portal large enough to fit yourself and one other individual of your size. It lasts for only a split second, but you may use it to transport yourself and an adjacent ally to a location anywhere within range regardless of whether or not you can see your destination. If you are trying to move to a spot you cannot see, your Grand Poohbah may require an Intelligence Check to determine how close you get to your target.

Tier_2.name: Tamberdoodle's Grasp
Tier_2.description: Gripping one of your arms at the wrist, you conjure a massive hand made of magical energy. The hand is Large in size, and appears in an unoccupied space of your choosing. You are able to command the hand as though it is an extension of your body, though it must remain within the spell's radius. The hand remains until it falls to zero health or you lose concentration on it.

Tier_2.name: Hava's Tricksy Escape
Tier_2.description: Close your eyes and repeat three times the words 'Whisked away, vanished' and then 'Poof!' As you finish, you disappear and in that moment a perfect illusion of you appears in your place. The illusion is an echo of your soul and moves and acts perfectly as you would have for the spell's duration. When the spell ends, your duplicate disappears and you recieve all of their memories.
Tier_2.upcast: You can spend an additional action point on this spell to make it last for ten minutes.

effect.description: While the spell is active, you are Invisible.

Tier_3.name: Winged Magic Steed
Tier_3.description: Raise your fingers to your mouth and whistle. Instantly, a winged steed appears, made of pure magical energy. The stallion may be de-summoned on command and has 20 health.

Tier_3.name: Edmire's Grand Manor
Tier_3.description: When you learn this spell, a key appears in your hand. Any time that you wish, you may cast it spell to cause a door to appear, which may be unlocked with the key. Within, you find a massive mansion capable of housing up to 80 people comfortably in up to 20 bedrooms. The mansion is fully stocked with extravagant food and drink. It is manned by 100 servants, which are at the beck and call of the mansion's creator. You may design the mansion to have rooms that suit the needs of your party, for example a holy sanctum, dungeons, training grounds and a kitchen. At will, you may give additional keys to trusted individuals. As soon as they have a key, they learn this spell, and may also summon the door. Nothing that originated within the mansion may be taken out. However, items brought in may stay. Once a door to the mansion is used, it lingers for ten minutes. During that time, anyone that finds it may attempt to break in. Similarly, if a key is stolen someone unpermitted may gain entry.

Tier_3.name: Nothing but Unicorns
Tier_3.description: Glitter dances in the air as rainbows erupt from your mouth and fingertips, streaming in three lines towards your foes. As they streak forth, each of the colors tangle and combine into the form of a stampede of unicorns!

effect.description: Roll an Inner Fire check against your targets' Resistance. On success, their perception of reality is distorted. To them, you appear to take the form of a giant, jet black unicorn with blazing red eyes and a bloody horn. Meanwhile, the rest of the world begins to shimmer as sparkles emanate from objects randomly, and the ground begins to undulate. They are Frightened of you and are Distracted and Hindered.
effect.save: At the end of each of your turns, you must repeat your check.

Tier_3.name: Summon Bleck
Tier_3.description: Summon a mighty bleck to fight for you! A bleck is a gooey little creature with a one inch diameter. Bleck have one health, and are incapable of attacking. They move at a rate of one foot per minute. Bleck cannot be damaged by crushing force or blades, as they will merely be split and then reform. After five seconds, a bleck splits into two blecks. Each of these blecks wait for five seconds, and then split into two more. The weight of a million bleck is enough to kill a bleck. Bleck that are killed remain for 1 minute before dissolving into nothingness. After the spell's duration, all bleck are destroyed.

components: A piece of coal blessed by a high priest of Juliet (100gp)

Tier_3.name: I Know Malkizar!
Tier_3.description: Gather your strength and perform an ancient ritual of obfuscation. Alter the mind of everyone who viewed an event by convincing them that there was another person present named Malkizar. In fourteen words or fewer, describe what Malkizar did. Everyone who witnessed the event now earnestly believes that Malkizar was present and performed the action you described.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Bulwark against evil. Knights stand tall on the front-line of an adventuring party. All but unkillable, it is their duty to protect their less resilient companions, standing in the way of blows that would slay wizards and rogues where they stand. While many knights work for coin or glory, others are called by a higher purpose. Such paladins can learn divine magic and use it to heal their allies and burn their foes with radiant light. Whether serving as bastion or healer, knights are a shield, holding their party together and standing strong against any foe.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Knights are strong of body and spirit. Whether bending the bars of a prison cell, charging through a locked door, or putting enemies in their place, a knight's superior strength is of great use to their adventuring party. When things look grim, a party's knight can be counted on to keep going, no matter what. Vile curses, hazardous weather, and incredible fatigue can do little to cause a knight to flag.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Many knights have a special affinity for speaking with other men-at-arms, using the bond of battle to forge fast friendships. Gleaming plate can be intimidating to the peasantry, though it tends to inspire awe rather than fear.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: A knight can be counted on to stand at the front line, using their abilities to focus the attention of enemies and stop them from attacking a party's ranged combatants and mages. Your role as a knight will be to defend your party and to punish any enemy that would try to harm them.

paths.The Path of Shining Armor: You are an inspiration to your allies, and learn abilities which spurr them onward in even the most dire situations.

standard.name: Steel Yourself
standard.description: Prepare for an attack, hardening yourself against its damanage. As a Free Action, halve the damage of an attack made against you. You may declare this after seeing its outcome.

The Path of Shining Armor.name: Charge
The Path of Shining Armor.description: With a mighty cry, you barrel forth into the fray. Rush ahead 25ft. For the length, you are immune to exposed attacks and deal this ability's damage to any enemy whose space you move through.

effect.description: Enemies struck by your passing must make a spell power save or be knocked Prone.

The Path of Shining Armor.name: Inspiring Strike
The Path of Shining Armor.description: The sight of you landing an incredible blow fills your allies with determination.

effect.description: Grant an ally you can see a 1d6 inspiration dice. The dice lasts for 1 hour.

standard.name: Shield Of Men
standard.description: Burst forward to save someone from harm. As a reaction, jump in front of an ally to become the target of a physical attack aimed at them. Any damage you recieve as a result of this ability is halved.

standard.name: Shield Bash
standard.description: Smash into an enemy with your offhand as you attempt to knock them off balance.

effect.description: Make a strength check against their resistance. On success, they are Exposed to the next attack made against them.

standard.name: Goad
standard.description: Call a challenge to an enemy.

effect.description: Make a Charisma check against their Resistance. On success, they become fixated on you until the end of their next turn.

standard.name: Phalanx
standard.description: Adopt a defensive stance, granting all allies within five feet your protection.

effect.description: While they stand at your side, your allies are considered to be Guarded.

The Path of Shining Armor.name: Lionhearted
The Path of Shining Armor.description: Your presence soothes your allies, inspiring them and guarding them against fear.

effect.description: Grant all allies within the ability's radius a 1d4 inspiration dice. Furthermore, for the ability's duration, any friendly creaturess who are within this ability's radius are immune to the Frightened condition.

standard.name: Controlled Advance
standard.description: As a foe falls to your blade, use the oportunity to push into their ranks. Whenever you slay an enemy with a melee attack, you may step forward into the space that they occupied. You are immune to exposed attacks during this movement. Once you've moved, you may make a standard attack.

standard.name: Overwhelming Strike
standard.description: With a blow like a hammerfall, you batter your enemy a devestating attack.

effect.description: Make a strength check against their resistance. On success, they are Staggered.

standard.name: None Shall Pass
standard.description: You are a bulwark of steel, hindering any enemy advance.

effect.description: When you make an exposed attack, you may make a Strength check against your target's Resistance. On success, they are Halted. On failure, they are Hindered.

standard.name: Cleave
standard.description: Swing your weapon in a wide arc, targetting all enemies within 5ft. of you.

The Path of Shining Armor.name: Move!
The Path of Shining Armor.description: As you read the tide of the battle, call out a quick order to one of your allies.
The Path of Shining Armor.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to spur them to action, allowing them to take movement and make one action or offhand action.

effect.description: They are Spurred to Movement.

standard.name: Slowing Strike
standard.description: Make an attack meant to hinder your enemy's movement.

effect.description: Make a strength check against their resistance. On success, they are slowed until the end of their next turn.

standard.name: Very Dangerous over Short Distances
standard.description: Once you've closed with an enemy, you are able to press the advantage.

effect.description: If you begin your turn next to a creature, deal an extra 1d6 damage on any attacks that you make against them.

standard.name: Stay on Your Feet
standard.description: Even battered and bloodied, you fight on. If you fall to zero health, make a an Inner Fire check with a target of 14. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

The Path of Shining Armor.name: Aura of Hope
The Path of Shining Armor.description: You are a powerful bastion, a protector for your allies.

effect.description: If an ally stands within the effect's radius, they may add +2 to all checks against enemy Threat, and make death coin flips at advantage.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: All muscle and rage, the Barbarian is a powerful frontline fighter. With their exceptional health and resileince, the Barbarian is able to shrug off blows that would level their allies. Once a Barbarian closes with an enemy they deal massive damage, laying low anyone that dares stand in their way. Out of combat, the Barbarian is among the strongest of the classes, and they use that strength to overcome their problems. The Barbarian's main weakness is their lack of arcane knowledge; for this reason, they are best backed up by a Bard, Cleric, or other support mage.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: The Barbarian's great strength is vital while adventuring. Whether they are bursting through walls or heaving great boulders, members of the Barbarian's party will stand on in awe as they use their strength to perform feats that look like magic.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: While many Barbarians are at home among ruffians and thieves, others are gentle giants. Regardless, any Barbarian is able to use their demeanor to intimidate if necessary. When questioning someone, the party may deploy their Barbarian to learn the truth.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Because of their strength and resilience, a party's Barbarian is usually found on the front line of combat. They are expert at both offense and defense. As a Barbarian grows in strength, their abilities layer atop one another, until even a normal attack deals massive damage. Barbarians are weak against magical attacks, however, and need a solid back line to support them.

paths.The Path of Rage: You are a force to be reckoned with, using your rage to lay your enemies low.

standard.name: Berserk
standard.description: Rage fills and threatens to consume you.
standard.upcast: Optionally, you may choose to make Berserk last twice as long, however, when it ends you suffer one level of Exhaustion.

effect.description: For the ability's duration, you are Resistant to physical damage and have advantage on any strength check.

The Path of Rage.name: Single Out
The Path of Rage.description: Survey the battlefield and pick out an enemy that you hate in particular.

effect.description: You gain 15ft of movement on any turn when you move towards them and they are considered Exposed to your attacks.

The Path of Rage.name: Frightening Blow
The Path of Rage.description: Spittle flies from your mouth as you strike at a foe.

effect.description: Make a strength check against your target's Resistance. On success, they are Frightened of you. If they die as a result of a strike, choose a different target within 30ft. to become Frightened.

standard.name: Meat Shield
standard.description: When you see an incoming attack, you may attempt to shield yourself with an adjacent enemy.

effect.description: Make a Strength Check against their Resistance. On success, they take the damage instead of you.

standard.name: Thirst for Blood
standard.description: Your weapon creaks beneath your grip. While you are Berserk, increase dice size of your primary weapon by one step.

standard.name: Brutal Attack
standard.description: Your muscles buldge and the earth shakes as you lash out at your enemy with a particularly vicious attack.

effect.description: Make a strength check against their Resistance. On success, they are knocked Prone.

standard.name: Throw Caution to the Wind
standard.description: Swing at your foes with reckless abandon, dealing bonus damage but leaving yourself exposed.

effect.description: At any time, you may declare that your attacks deal extra damage. However, when you make such an attack, you become Exposed until the start of your next turn.

The Path of Rage.name: Terrify
The Path of Rage.description: As the enemy you've singled out looks up at your dark, rage-filled eyes, their constitution shakes.

effect.description: Make a Strength Check against their Resistance. On success, they become frightened of you until the end of their next turn.

standard.name: Every Wall is a Door
standard.description: Use your strength to blast through an obstacle that is two feet thick or less, to climb solid stone, or to leap a trecherous gap. Move up to your base speed unimpeded. You are still vulnerable to exposed attacks.

standard.name: The Closer
standard.description: If you attack an enemy that is prone, deal bonus damage.

standard.name: Throw Anything
standard.description: Sometimes, you can't get close enough to punch. You are able to treat any object that you throw as a regular weapon with a thrown range of 30ft. Additionally, if you use the Meat Shield ability and the target dies, you may immediately make an attack using them as a thrown weapon.

standard.name: Resistant Rage
standard.description: Your rage is so complete that you can shield yourself against enemy abilities.

effect.description: While going Berserk, roll any checks against an enemy's Threat with advantage.

The Path of Rage.name: A Little Terror
The Path of Rage.description: Use your intimidating presense to force an enemy to do your will.

effect.description: Make a strength check against their resistance. On success, they are Controlled for one turn or must answer three of your questions truthfully.

standard.name: Stay on Your Feet
standard.description: Even battered and bloodied, you fight on. If you fall to zero health, make an Inner Fire Check with a target of 14. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

standard.name: Chain Attack
standard.description: As your foes' bodies fall around you, a fiendish energy courses through your veins.

effect.description: Whenever you slay an enemy, you are Spurred to Action.

standard.name: The Opener
standard.description: The chance of violence spurrs you forward.

effect.description: On the first turn of combat, you are Quickened. Additionally, if you attack an enemy that has not yet taken a turn, use Brutal Attack at no cost.

The Path of Rage.name: You're Next!
The Path of Rage.description: If you slay your Singled Out target, you may immediately move 25ft and make a standard attack.

effect.description: If your target survives, they are Frightened of you until the end of their next turn.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Knives in the dark, rogues are famously stealthy and perceptive. They blend into crowds like shadow, gathering information or relieving a mark of their life or possessions. Rogues have little health, and as such, it can be disastrous if they are struck by an enemy attack. Thankfully, their stealth and abilities make them among the most slippery of combatants. While others tackle their challenges head on, rogues wait to find openings—when life gives you a guarded door, a rogue is the first to go in through a window.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Incredibly dexterous, rogues are skilled at mantling buildings, lurking in the shadows, disarming traps and picking locks. As a rogue, you will often go in first to make certain the way is safe, using your abilities to clear a path for the less-nimble members of your adventuring party.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: While some rogues stand back silently, others are charming and deceptive. With their nimble fingers, rogues are skilled at pocketing items that aren't theirs, though the wise rogue won't target their party with such exploits.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Rogues have low health but deal heavy damage to their foes. In combat, they spend much of their time skirting the edges of the fray, looking for opportunities to dash in, land a critical blow, and then disappear into the shadows. Rogues are adept at fighting with daggers, hurling them at opponents and slashing multiple times to deal quick, repeated damage. If a rogue invests in magic, they can use their abilities to avoid damage by becoming invisible, fill an area with shadows, or even launch themselves high into the air.

paths.The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator: You use magic to supplement your stealth, allowing you to go where others cannot and to manipulate objects at a distance.
paths.The Path of the Assassin: You focus on slaying foes quickly, striking from the shadows when they least expect it.

standard.name: Disengage
standard.description: You dodge and weave between your foes, focusing your energy on avoiding combat.

effect.description: For the remainder of your turn, you are Elusive. While out of combat, you may use Disengage to gain advantage on stealth checks for ten minutes.

The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.name: Unseen Hand
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.description: Mutter a spell to will an ethereal hand into existence. While you concentrate on it, the hand acts as an extension of your will. The hand has a flying speed of 25 feet and may not leave the spell's radius. Its strength score is equivalent to your inner fire modifier, but uses -3 as it's dexterity modifier. In gameplay tier 2, this is replaced by your Dexterity as you master using the hand at a distance.

The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.name: Thief's Mark
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.description: As you lay a hand on a creature, a small brand glows on their skin.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you always know in which direction the creature lies. Attacks that you make against the creature deal 1d6 additional damage.

The Path of the Assassin.name: Strike From The Shadows
The Path of the Assassin.description: Silent as a shadow, you slip behind a foe and take them unawares.

effect.description: Add 1d6 damage to attacks made from hiding.

The Path of the Assassin.name: Precision Strike
The Path of the Assassin.description: With a hiss of air, your blade effortlessly slices through an enemy.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity Check against your target's Resistance. On success, the damage dealt by this ability is considered Bleeding.

standard.name: Dodge
standard.description: Attempt to pivot out of the way of an incoming attack.
standard.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this ability to cause the Evasion to persist until the start of your next turn.

effect.description: As Reaction, become Evasive.

standard.name: Thief's Strike
standard.description: While you stab an enemy with one hand, you attempt to rob them blind with the other.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity Check against your target's Resistance. On success, you are able to steal one object from them. If your attack is ranged, you may instead declare that an object is knocked free of their grasp. The object must be held by or tethered to them, and you must be able to explain how you manage to steal it in a way that is acceptable to the Grand Poohbah.

standard.name: Flank
standard.description: When your allies are near an enemy, you are able to avoid that foe's sight.

effect.description: If a creature is Harried, you are considered to be hiding when attacking from behind them. If you begin a turn flanking an enemy, you may break from them without provoking exposed attacks.

standard.name: Dart In
standard.description: When you use your Action to dash, you may end the movement with a melee attack.

The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.name: Spell Of Invisibility
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.description: With a muttered breath, you touch your magic and you cloak yourself in an ethereal shroud.
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this ability to cause it to last for one hour.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you are Invisible to the mortal eye, a wraith among the living. Your invisibility ends if you take damage or make an attack.

The Path of the Assassin.name: Jab
The Path of the Assassin.description: Slice at an enemy with your offhand in an attempt to knock them off balance.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity check against their Resistance. On success, they are Staggered.

standard.name: Flow with the Battle
standard.description: You are a master of pivoting around your foes,

effect.description: and are able to pass through an enemy's space in combat.

standard.name: Ride The Blindspot
standard.description: You have learned to stay behind a flanked enemy, even if they try to turn on you.

effect.description: If an enemy you have flanked tries to look at you, you may spend an action point to pivot around them as a reaction. If they try to move, you may move with them. Ride the Blindspot continues until the end of the enemy's turn.

standard.name: Assisted Strike
standard.description: You use your foe's distraction to your advantage.

effect.description: When an enemy is adjacent to one of your allies, they are considered Exposed to you.

standard.name: Slip Away
standard.description: You are able to streak in, harm a foe, and then retreat again.

effect.description: Whenever you strike an enemy, you are considered Elusive to them until the end of your turn.

The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.name: Leap
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.description: As you speak the magic word for 'Ascent' you suddenly launch thirty feet into the air. By angling your body, you are able to turn this into an arc.

The Path of the Assassin.name: Wasting Blow
The Path of the Assassin.description: As you land a particularly well placed blow, you slice into your opponent's vitals and sap their strength.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity Check against their Resistance. On success, their next attack is Weakened.

standard.name: Evasion
standard.description: Use your uncanny knack for survival to avoid an explosion or other area of effect attack.

effect.description: When an area of effect attack calls for you to make a check against an enemy's Threat, you take half damage on a failure or no damage on a success.

standard.name: Reduced Critical
standard.description: When you make a called shot, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

standard.name: Throw Caution to the Wind
standard.description: Surge forward with reckless abandon, dealing bonus damage but leaving yourself exposed.

effect.description: At any time, you may declare that your attacks deal extra damage. However, when you make such an attack, you become Vulnerable until the start of your next turn.

The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.name: Controlled Descent
The Path of the Arcane Infiltrator.description: The moment before you strike the earth, release a burst of magic to slow yourself.

effect.description: Reduce any falling damage to zero.

The Path of the Assassin.name: Chain Attack
The Path of the Assassin.description: As your enemies' bodies fall around you, a fiendish energy courses through your veins.

effect.description: Whenever you slay an enemy, you are Spurred to Action.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Protectors of natural order, Rangers are masters of traversing the wilderness. Tales of Rangers are sung in the borderlands, where the wilds crash against civilization. Rangers silently push back against the chaos of the wilds, protecting unwitting villagers from abberations, fiends, and wild things. Rangers rarely stay in one place, and the area under their protection can span for hundreds of miles. This means that their relationships are few and transient, though some take an animal companion or find friendship with a local druid or wizard. Rangers are often among the first to realize when something sinister is brewing. When they end up in an adventuring party, it is usually because something has threatened the natural order and they believe that they can help restore it.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Rangers are invaluable when traversing the wilderness, using their high Perception and Dexterity to lead the way through trecherous climbs. Rangers are expert at piecing tracking foes and piecing together what happened from even the faintest sign.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: While rangers have a reputation as brooding figures found in the corner of the local tavern, they command great respect from the citizens of border towns. A ranger's word carries weight, and even the few question their expertise when it comes to monsters or monster-hunting.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Rangers are intelligent combatants who fight with precision and care. Their Analyze ability allows them to learn their enemy before striking, dealing extra damage and finding ways to slip through their defenses. Some rangers choose to master the blade, while others keep a distance, choosing the Path of the Hunter and wielding the bow. Regardless, Rangers are fierce combatants who excel at targetting and slaying individual foes.

paths.The Path of the Blade: You have honed your skill with the blade, learning to counter your foes and exploit their weaknesses.
paths.The Hunter's Path: You wield the bow, picking off targets from a distance with deadly precision.

standard.name: Analyze
standard.description: Spend a moment watching an enemy. Learn one fact of your choice about the creature, for example, what its Threat is.

effect.description: For the ability's duration, increase the damage dice of your attacks by one step when attacking the creature. When out of combat, take advantage on tracking checks made against analyzed creatures.

The Path of the Blade.name: Guard-Break
The Path of the Blade.description: Swing high and fast in an effort to batter away your opponent's defenses.

effect.description: Make a dexterity check against their Resistance. On success, they become Exposed until the end of their next turn.

The Path of the Blade.name: Blade Parry
The Path of the Blade.description: Attempt to deflect a hand-to-hand attack made against you. Roll 1d6 + Dexterity and deduct the total from the damage. At gameplay tiers 2 and 3, increase the dice rolled to 1d8 and 1d10, respsectively.

The Hunter's Path.name: Grappler's Line
The Hunter's Path.description: Affix a chord to your arrow and fire it at a target. As it hits, it holds fast, creating a durable link between you.

effect.description: If your target is a living creature, you must make a Dexterity Check against their Resistance. On success, they become Tethered to you.

The Hunter's Path.name: Decoy Call
The Hunter's Path.description: From hiding, you cup your hands and make a perfect monster call.

effect.description: Make a Charisma Check against your target's Resistance. On success, they are Lured to a point of your choosing.

standard.name: Fade Step
standard.description: You reposition with practiced footwork.

effect.description: Move up to 15ft without provoking exposed attacks. This movement ignores difficult terrain and may carry you through enemy spaces.

standard.name: Hindering Blow
standard.description: You aim a carefully placed attack in order to slow your target's advance.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity Check against their Resistance. On success, they are Hindered.

standard.name: Read the Signs
standard.description: By surveying the terrain, you piece together what transpired there. Make an intelligence check to when you encounter monster tracks or signs of a struggle. On success, you understand what happened and the creatures involved are considered Analyzed.

standard.name: Follow Up
standard.description: Blow after blow, you wear your target down. If you attack an enemy, subsequent attacks deal extra damage if you don't choose another target. Extra damage starts at 1d4 and grows with each hit, capping at 1d8.

The Path of the Blade.name: Kick
The Path of the Blade.description: Kick your enemy hard in their center of mass. If they of size large or smaller, roll a Dexterity Check against their Resistance. On success, they are knocked back ten feet. You may optionally follow without provoking exposed attacks.

The Hunter's Path.name: Point Blank Stab
The Hunter's Path.description: When an enemy moves into your reach, you may stab them with an arrow. If they perish, you may immediately fire the arrow as a standard attack.

standard.name: Know Your Prey
standard.description: You have grown better at understanding your foes.

effect.description: When you analyze an enemy, add +2 to any checks made against their Threat or Resistance or to make Called Shots against them.

standard.name: Strider
standard.description: Your base movement is increased by 10ft.

effect.description: Additionally, difficult terrain no longer hinders you. When out of combat, take advantage on dexterity checks made to navigate natural obstacles.

standard.name: Backpedal
standard.description: As an attack skates off your armor, use the opportunity to reposition yourself. Whenever you are attacked, move 5ft without provoking exposed attacks as a free action.

standard.name: Lead the Way
standard.description: You spring into action before others can think. Whenever initiative is called, roll with advantage.

The Path of the Blade.name: Counter
The Path of the Blade.description: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, spend your reaction to counter-attack them.

The Hunter's Path.name: Focused Follow-Up
The Hunter's Path.description: You take a steadying breath and line up a perfect shot. If you take an attack action on this turn, roll the damage at advantage. If the attack slays it's target, you may immediately make another standard attack.

standard.name: Nimble
standard.description: Your perception is so advanced that you are able to avoid arrows and other ranged attacks.

effect.description: You are permanently considered to be Guarded against targeted ranged attacks.

standard.name: Overpowering Attack
standard.description: Make an attack meant to shatter your enemy's defenses.

effect.description: Make a Dexterity Check against their Resistance. On success, they are Vulnerable to the next attack made against them.

standard.name: Greater Analysis
standard.description: When you analyze a creature, all equivalent creatures of that type are also analyzed for the abilities duration.

The Path of the Blade.name: Storm of Swords
The Path of the Blade.description: Spend one action point to allow yourself to make a full action in place of your Offhand Action on this turn.

The Hunter's Path.name: Volley
The Hunter's Path.description: Fire arrow after arrow in a volley of arching shots. They rain down on enemies in an area of your choosing.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Servant of the divine. A cleric has given themselves over to the worship of a deity or deities. For some, this means a life spent in a temple, while for others, it means wandering the realms and preaching the good word. As an adventurer, your deity has chosen you for something special and has granted you the power to carry out their will. Clerics are practitioners of divine magic, and are known for their ability to bring healing to the sick and dying.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Clerics use divine magic to overcome their problems. When adventuring you may call back the soul of a departed person for questioning, bind an enemy in place, or project yourself across the realms to aid a distant ally. Unlike most other classes, the cleric always has someone in their corner. As they reach higher levels, a Cleric's deity or their servants may reach out, giving guidance and providing marching orders.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Clerics are welcome most everywhere, and it is not out of the ordinary for commonfolk to approach them for blessings or healing. Temples can be found scattered throughout the realms, and can serve as a friendly place for practitioners a given faith. Indeed, the only people who generally dislike clerics are those of competing faiths, or followers of dark gods in opposition to a cleric's deity.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Clerics often take a supporting role in combat, granting powerful boons to their allies and weakening their enemies. Healing magic is at the core of a cleric's arsenal; when a party's barbarian launches themselves headlong into a horde of skeletons, it is often the cleric that keeps them standing long enough to emerge victorious. Clerics are not without the ability to fight, however. With beams of scouring light, they are able to blind their foes and push them back into the darkness.

Tier_1.name: Beam of Light
Tier_1.description: A blinding beam of radiance streaks from your holy symbol towards your target.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, deal an additional dice of damage.

effect.description: If you roll max damage on any of the dice for this attack, your target is Blinded until the end of their next turn.

Tier_1.name: Ward of Protection
Tier_1.description: Pray over one of your allies, beseeching your deity to protect them from harm. As you pray, a ward of light shimmers over their heart.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, they are considered Guarded against all damage.

Tier_1.name: Prayer of Healing
Tier_1.description: As you channel the power of your deity, your voice resonates with profound compassion. Echoing waves of healing knit your target's wounds shut. If you physically touch your target, double the number of dice rolled.

Tier_1.name: Bind
Tier_1.description: Focus your intent upon an encroaching enemy and lift your hand to stop them.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, you may attempt to bind two more creatures.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against the creature's Resistance. On success, they are frozen in place and Incapacitated.
effect.save: You must repeat your check at the end of each of your turns. If the enemy is injured, they spell's effect ends for them.

Tier_1.name: Enlarge
Tier_1.description: As you grasp your holy symbol, glowing energy suffuses a creature of your choosing.

effect.description: At once, their body Enlarged. You may choose to cast this spell using concentration.
effect.save: For an unwilling target, you must repeat your check at the end of each of their turns or once every five minutes when out of combat.

Tier_1.name: Mend
Tier_1.description: Your hands glow as you magically mend small dents, dings, scratches, and tears on an item you are touching. You may also use this spell to render poisons innocuous, heal minor status effects such as drunkenness, or to convert water to holy water at a rate of one gallon per hour. Mending can be used on a person to remove a status effect or to render a curse innocuous for one day.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an action point on this spell to increase it's power, mending larger items such as broken walls, wheels, or armor.

Tier_1.name: Holy Light
Tier_1.description: With a muttered prayer, you raise an object aloft and it illuminates, casting light within the spell's radius.

effect.description: Undead and demonic creatures who begin their turn within the light are Staggered.

Tier_1.name: Speak with the Dead
Tier_1.description: Anoint a body with holy oil and clutch a candle close. As you reach out to your diety, the candle flares as the deceased's spirit returns to the mortal coil. The corpse cannot move, but is able to speak so long as it's mouth and ears are present. You may ask it three questions before the spell ends and the flame goes out. This spell may be cast on a given creature exactly once.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend an additional action point to ask five questions of the corpse.

Tier_1.name: Leap of Faith
Tier_1.description: Look skyward and put your faith in your diety. As you step out onto a surface that will not hold you, it is instead solid and safe. In this way you can walk atop water, molten earth, or even across thin air. This spell continues until you lose concentration or until you have moved 300 feet.

Tier_1.name: Speak Tongues
Tier_1.description: Your deity touches your tongue and allows you to communicate its word to others. You are able to speak and understand any language for the spell's duration.

Tier_2.name: Excoriating Beam
Tier_2.description: A blinding beam of light streaks forth, ringed with halos. The blast harms everyone in a line before you, but is stopped by inanimate objects with a width greater than one foot.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to allow it to pass through obejcts with a width up to five feet.

effect.description: For any target hit by the beam, make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are Blinded until the end of their next turn.

Tier_2.name: Fiery Rebuke
Tier_2.description: White hot flames fill the space around you as you call on your deity for protection. They deal damage to everyone in the spell's radius.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, increase its radius by 10 feet.

Tier_2.name: Mass Heal
Tier_2.description: Hands clasped, you pray for the health of all those around you. Glowing golden light wraps any allies within the spell's radius as they are healed.

Tier_2.name: Remove Curse
Tier_2.description: Sit beside a creature that you believe has a curse. Wash them with holy water and purify their wounds with salt. Lay a piece of untarnished silver over their heart and call upon your diety. For most curses and status effects, this ritual will remove them and also restore full health to your target. For some powerful curses, you may be forced to make a check by the Grand Poohbah. If a fiend placed the curse, they may appear to try to reclaim their prize.

Tier_2.name: Sphere of Encasement
Tier_2.description: Hold a piece of quarts to your eye and view a creature through it. At once, an orb of unbreakable magical energy forms around them. Nothing may pass through the orb, though it always has enough oxygen for the creature within. The creature inside can push the orb to cause it to rotate, moving a distance up to half its movement on its turn.

Tier_2.name: Dispel Magic
Tier_2.description: Carefully undo the weave of a first tier spell or curse. If the magic that you seek to reverse is of a higher tier, a check must be made as defined by the Grand Poohbah. Dispel magic does not heal damage or repair magically damaged objects.

Tier_2.name: Scry
Tier_2.description: Press a focusing gem against a reflective surface and speak the primordial word for 'reveal.' The gem instantly merges with the surface, leaving it iridescent. You are able to view a person or place that you know as if through a one way window. The scry spell cannot penetrate lead or certain protective spells. By default, sound is not conveyed. However, you can optionally let a person know that you are scrying them. If they are a mage, they are able to spend one action point to tether your scrying spell to a nearby reflective object, allowing you to communicate with one another.
Tier_2.upcast: If you target an unwilling creature with this spell, you may make an inner fire check against your their resistance. On success, you are able to hear them. On failure, they know that someone tried to scry on them.

Tier_2.name: Town Portal
Tier_2.description: When you enter a town, you may pray over a dwelling and draw a holy glyph on the doorframe. From that point forward, you may perform a ritual to open a door to that location, regardless of distance. You may mark at most one building per town in this way.

Tier_2.name: Truesight
Tier_2.description: Your eyes shimmer with holy light as you speak a prayer for clarity.

effect.description: By the power of your deity, grant yourself Trusight.

Tier_2.name: M&M's Beckoning Call
Tier_2.description: Lay your hands on a willing creature and imbue them with magic of recall. One time over the spell's duration, you are able to instantly teleport them to a space adjacent to you, regardless of distance. This teleportation has the same restrictions as any other, may be blocked by certain spells or abilities, and is performed as a Free Action.

Tier_3.name: Pillar of Dawn
Tier_3.description: Spread your hands wide as you summon forth the glory of your deity. A pillar of fire falls from the heavens and envelops a radius of your choosing. The fire crackles and spreads, reducing your target to cinders.

effect.description: Anyone struck by the beam is instantly set ablaze and begins Burning.

Tier_3.name: Resurrection
Tier_3.description: Lay out the body of someone who has died within the past week. Spend time anointing them with oil, burning incense, and using your magic to mend their body. Lay a soul gem on their chest and ask your deity for their strength. Roll 1d20. If the result is 11 or higher, reclaim the target's soul and return them to life. On failure, they may not be resurrected.
Tier_3.upcast: If someone who loved the deceased dearly helps you, they may spend one action point to to grant you advantage on your check.

Tier_3.name: Avatar
Tier_3.description: Close your eyes and empty your mind. By the will of your diety, project your conciousness across the void. A faintly glowing copy of you appears somewhere in the Realms at a location of your choosing. You control the copy as though it is you. The copy has full health and action points, and knows your abilities. It persists until your real body loses concentration on it, or until it falls to zero health and disappears.

Tier_3.name: Mantle of Dawn
Tier_3.description: A halo blazes about your head, shedding radiant light in a radius around you.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, all allies within the radius are Diminished. At the spells start, all allies in the radius are Inspired.

Tier_3.name: Invulnerability
Tier_3.description: Magic suffuses your target, and their skin becomes hard as diamond even as all magics are repelled from them.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, they are considered Invincible.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Students of the arcane, wizards are practitioners of world-bending magics. Advanced wizards can take flight, smite their foes with balls of fire, and bend time to their whim. Even fledgling wizards can summon magic familiars, conjure candlight, and fill their foes mouths' with slithering slugs. These advanced magics come at a price—wizards must study diligently to gain their power, standing on the shoulders of giants as they strive to become legends in their own right.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: A wizard's arsenal of spells is of great use when adventuring. The ability to become ethereal, step between distant doors, and summon platforms are of immense value to any adventuring party. With their great intelligence, wizards are also of use whenever questions of history, geography, or intuition are encountered.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Some wizards are scatterbrained, others stoic, and some are merely excited to see the world. While a wizard might have trouble being the party's face when dealing with common folk, they can be of enormous value whenever speaking with the intelligentsia of a region.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: A wizard's spells can shape the face of combat, taking powerful enemies out of play through a combination of serious damage and status effects. However, wizards are notorious for their frail forms and low health. As such, wizards must boost their defense with magic, or hide behind their more resilient allies.

Tier_1.name: Flare
Tier_1.description: You smear a streak of phosphorus upon a pebble and hold your hand aloft, loosing a beam of fire at your target.

effect.description: If you roll max damage on this attack, your target begins Burning.

Tier_1.name: Arcane Blow
Tier_1.description: With a sound like a thunderclap, you punch your foe with a fist instilled with arcane power.

effect.description: If they are large or smaller, roll an inner fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are knocked back 15 feet. On a natural 20, they are knocked Prone.

Tier_1.name: Jet of Frost
Tier_1.description: Frigid air howls from your focus, biting at the enemies in a cone before you.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against your foes' resistance. On success, they are Hindered.

Tier_1.name: Pindigae's Arcane Orbs
Tier_1.description: Two multicolored orbs of crackling energy swirl about you before streaking towards as many targets. Make one attack per orb. The orbs do not need to target a single creature.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, fire an additional orb.

Tier_1.name: Arcane Armor
Tier_1.description: Grip a lump of iron in your hand. As you grasp your magic, the iron glows and is consumed.

effect.description: A shimmering set of armor appears upon you, and you are Guarded for the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Eat Slugs
Tier_1.description: Fixing your eyes on your target, you crush a writhing bug between your fingers.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are Staggered.

Tier_1.name: Candlelight
Tier_1.description: Roll a piece of string between your fingers and channel your magic into it. It magically ignites, but is not burned. The flickering light hovers at your side. The light is difficult to snuff and obeys your subconcious commands, moving as you instruct it within a radius centered on you. If it leaves the radius, it continues to hover, but cannot obey you. The candle gives off light within a thirty foot radius.

components: A piece of string or wick

Tier_1.name: Featherfall
Tier_1.description: Grip a feather between your fingers and your magic ignites it. Choose a creature or object to slow its falling speed to that of a feather.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to use this spell on up to five additonal objects or creatures.

Tier_1.name: Bubble of Air
Tier_1.description: Knead a bit of soap and blow upon it.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to create five additional bubbles of air.

effect.description: A shimmering bubble of breathable air appears around your target's head, sustaining them for up to one hour.

Tier_1.name: Summon Familiar
Tier_1.description: Summon a small animal such as a bat, dog, or rat to be your familiar. The familiar follows your instructions with intelligence, and you are able to meditate to see through it's eyes. If your familiar is de-summoned or killed, you may cast this spell again to bring it back. You may spend one action point to instantly teleport your familiar to yourself, but it drops whatever it is holding. Additionally, so long as your familiar is within 100ft of you, you may cast a spell from its position. During combat, your familiar acts on your turn and has a movement speed of 30ft. Whenever you re-summon your familiar, you are able to change its form. Your familiar has a number of hit points equal to your inner fire.

Tier_2.name: Ice Spear
Tier_2.description: Vapor in the air crystalizes into a spear of ice and hurtles towards your target.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to add 2d6 damage.

Tier_2.name: Fireball
Tier_2.description: Clap your hands together to summon a bead of sizzling light. It streaks towards your target before erupting into a massive fireball.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against your targets' Resistance. On success, they begin Burning.

Tier_2.name: Chain Lightning
Tier_2.description: Thunder peels over and over as your magic leaps from target to target. After your lightning hits your first target, roll 1d4. If the roll is greater than 1, the lightning chains to another enemy of your choice. Continue until you roll a 1. Lightning may only strike the same creature twice and may leap a maximum of ten times.

Tier_2.name: Octahedral Barrier
Tier_2.description: In a rush of energy, a pyramid of solid magic forms around you and serves as a barrier.

effect.description: It protects you and any allies in close proximity from an incoming ranged or magical attack.

Tier_2.name: Door Step
Tier_2.description: As you place your hand on a door-handle or walk through an archway, magic flows through you, opening a portal to another door within range. Instantaneously transport to that doorway.

Tier_2.name: Invisibility
Tier_2.description: Over the span of a second, you target's skin, then organs, then bones disappear.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, they are Invisible.

Tier_2.name: Message
Tier_2.description: Hold an object which belongs to someone you've met. You are able to telepathically send them a message of up to 25 words, regardless of distance. The creature then has sixty seconds to respond to you, also with 25 words.

components: An item that belongs to your target

Tier_2.name: Become Ethereal
Tier_2.description: Your form flickers as you enter the plane of the ethereal. You may stay there for a number of minutes equal to your inner fire or until you choose to regain your material form as a free action.

effect.description: While in this state, you are considered Ethereal.

Tier_2.name: Platform
Tier_2.description: With a twist of your hand, a circular disk of purple light appears at a point of your choosing. The disk is one foot thick and is formed of solid magic. It is capable of holding any amount of weight. If a target is in the disk's space, it may leap atop it.

Tier_2.name: Dispel Magic
Tier_2.description: Carefully undo the weave of a first tier spell or curse. If the magic that you seek to reverse is of a higher tier, a check must be made as defined by the Grand Poohbah. Dispel magic does not heal damage or repair magically damaged objects.

Tier_3.name: Gate
Tier_3.description: Energy hums as you tear a rift in reality and create a gate to another place. The gate stands ten feet tall and twenty feet wide. You may target a specific location that you have visited as the other side of the gate, or else make an intelligence check to target somewhere you have not been. The target may be another of the Realms.

Tier_3.name: Fly
Tier_3.description: The weave of magic supports and guides you and gravity fades away. For the spell's duration, your target can fly. Their flying speed is equal to twice their normal walking speed.
Tier_3.upcast: For each additional action point spent, grant four more creatures the power of flight.

Tier_3.name: Tri-beam
Tier_3.description: A pulse of energy fills the air around you as you tear the fabric of reality and touch the realm of chaos. Hair stands on end, and a chill runs down the spine of everyone present. Pointing at your targets, you loose three beams of raw magic.

effect.description: Roll an attack for each beam, then roll 1d6.
options: On a 1, the beam is a ray of weakness which deals necrotic damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they are Weakened.
On a 2, the beam is a ray of fire which deals fire damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they begin Burning.
On a 3, the beam is a ray of frost which deals frost damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they are Slowed.
On a 4, the beam is a ray of disruption which deals psychic damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they are Dumbstruck.
On a 5, the beam is a ray of electricity which deals lightning damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they are Stunned.
On a 6, the beam is a ray of death which deals necrotic damage. Make an inner fire check against the target's Resistance. On success, they begin begin Rotting.

Tier_3.name: Black Hole
Tier_3.description: There is a moment of silence as a black speck, smaller than a gnome's fingernail, appears, hanging at a point of your choosing. Then, there is a scream of air as all inanimate objects within the spell's radius are pulled 25 feet towards the newly summoned black hole. The black hole instantly swells to the size of a halfling as debris reaches it.

effect.description: Each turn, everyone within the spell's radius must make a D15 strength check or be pulled 1d6 x 5 feet towards the black hole. All creatures that begin their turn within 50 feet of the black hole are Hindered, and anyone who touches the black hole takes the spell's damage.

Tier_3.name: Stop Time
Tier_3.description: As you spin a timepiece in your hand, focus your magic on it and speak the forgotten tongue of the Timekeepers. In a radius around you, time slows to a crawl.

components: A stopwatch, hourglass, or other time-telling implement

Tier_3.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to increase the spell's radius to 300 feet.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against the Resistance of everyone in the spell's radius. On success, they are stopped in time, and are Incapacitated for the spell's duration. Anyone or anything that is touched or attacked is instantly returned to the normal flow of time.

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Bound to darkness. By ambition or necessity, a Warlock enters into a pact with an otherworldly force. This being grants them incredible magics, but at a cost; every pact has it's price. This price be anything from gathering information for your patron to performing tasks for them. Regardless, your pact and your patron will greatly color your adventuring career.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Warlocks have access to a vast array of useful magics which can aid any adventuring party. In particular, Warlocks are masters of gathering information; spells like Eyes of Uriel and Echoes of the Past allow you to view the world around you in a way no one else can. Like other casters, Warlocks have low health, and often stand back and watch as other party members throw themselves into harm's way.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Known for their Charisma, a warlock can easily become the face of an adventuring party. And when force of personality fails, magic can intervene. The powerful Convince and Mask of Shadows spells can be used to impersonate enemies or magically manipulate particularly troublesome individuals.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Warlocks shine in combat with one of the most aggressive spell lists in the realms. Elditch Blast, targets single foes, Tide of Shadow summons a cone of deadly dark, and Cthulian Tentacles causes eldritch protrusions to grasp at multiple foes.

Tier_1.name: Eldritch Blast
Tier_1.description: With a howl like the damned, a screaming bolt of green energy tears forth, decaying your enemies where it strikes. If you roll maximum damage on this spell, knock your opponent back 15 feet.

Tier_1.name: Tide of Shadow
Tier_1.description: Swirling black smoke billows in a cloud before you, damaging enemies in a cone.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against your targets' Resistance. On success, they are Blinded until the end of their next turn.

Tier_1.name: Wilting Touch
Tier_1.description: Black veins creep down your arms as you grip an enemy and channel powerful necrotic energy into them.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against their resistance. On success, they begin Rotting.

Tier_1.name: Surrogate
Tier_1.description: As an enemy attack hurtles towards you, attempt to compel someone block it.

effect.description: Make an inner fire check against the resistance of the nearest hostile creature. On success, they dive in front of you to save you from an attack.

Tier_1.name: Shadow Ward
Tier_1.description: Create a shroud of inky darkness around yourself.

effect.description: Allies can see through, but enemies are considered to be in magical darkness and are Blinded. Additionally, you are resistant to targeted ranged attacks while within the darkness.

Tier_1.name: Curse
Tier_1.description: Muttering an oath, you place a curse upon a creature of your choosing. Whenever you attack that creature, deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage. If the creature dies, you may immediately move the curse to another creature within range.

Tier_1.name: Mental Assault
Tier_1.description: Hideous and discordant voices fill your target's ears.

effect.description: At the start of their turns, make an inner fire check against their Resistance. On success, they are distracted.

Tier_1.name: Telepathy
Tier_1.description: You are able to project your thoughts into someone's mind. Willing participants can let you to read their thoughts, allowing for two-way communication. For non-willing participants, you are able to glean only surface level detail unless you wish to probe deeper. To do so, you must make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, you are able to glean something of their inner thoughts, but they know that their mind has been read.

Tier_1.name: Embed Eye
Tier_1.description: Embed a magical eye in a non-living material. The eye has 1 hit point, but is ethereal. While the eye is closed, it is invisible. For the spell's duration, you can concentrate to cause the eye to open and to see through it.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend one additional action point to cause the eye to last for 1 week, or two to make it last for one month.

Tier_1.name: Echoes of the Past
Tier_1.description: Echoes and specters dance in your vision as you reach into the past. For the duration, you are able to see what happened within the spell's radius over the past day. However, you cannot see everyone who was present. Roll 1d6 to determine the number of people you are able to see.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to look back within the past week.

Tier_2.name: Hurl Through Hell
Tier_2.description: A gaping pit envelops your enemy and sends them careening through the nine layers of the abyss.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they spend 1d4-1 (minimum 1) turns falling through the hells. On failure, they take half damage and are not sucked into the portal. When they return from the abyss, they reappear and slam to the earth, falling Prone and taking the spell's damage.

Tier_2.name: Murder of Crows
Tier_2.description: With a sound like a rush of wind, a murder of crows streaks past you and to a location of your choice, dealing damage as it goes. For the spell's duration, any enemy who begins their turn within the swarm or who passes through it takes damage. As an offhand action on your turn, you may command the murder of crows to move up to 30 feet. A creature may be harmed at most one time by a swarm of crows per round of combat.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to increase the duration of this spell to 4 turns.

Tier_2.name: Cthulian Tentacles
Tier_2.description: At your command, shadows coallesce into hideous tentacles and burst from the ground. Together, they converge on two of your foes.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an action point to create two additional tentacles, attacking two additional creatures in range.

effect.description: Make Inner Fire checks against your targets' Resistance. On success, they are Grappled, and take damage at the start of each turn.

Tier_2.name: Shadowstep
Tier_2.description: Fade into the darkness and immediately re-appear within a shadow in the spell's range. Both the start and destination of this spell must be in partial darkness.

Tier_2.name: Tethered Minds
Tier_2.description: Tether the minds of up to eight individuals. For the spell's duration, they are able to speak telepathically regardless of distance. The effects of the spell end if a creature enters another realm.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to make it last 6 hours, or two more to make it last 24 hours.

Tier_2.name: Eyes of Uriel
Tier_2.description: As you hold both hands aloft, 1d4+1 eyes open in the air behind you. Each is the size of a balled fist, and they float in a halo about you. The eyes move slowly, and travel at about the walking speed of a normal person, fifteen feet per turn. If you concentrate, you can see through the eyes. When the eyes close, they become Ethereal and cannot be seen.

effect.description: If an eye is within fifteen feet of an attack, you may use your reaction to cause the eye to sacrifice itself and become the attack's target instead.

Tier_2.name: Armor of Lucien
Tier_2.description: For a moment, radiant armor appears about you before fading from vision. For the spell's duration, your gain an amount of temporary health equal to your inner fire times five. When the temporary health is gone or the spell's duration elapses, the spell ends. While the spell is active, anyone who strikes you takes damage.

Tier_2.name: Shared Fate
Tier_2.description: Tether two creatures together.

effect.description: If one dies, make an Inner Fire check against the other's Resistance. On failure, they take an amount of damage equal to the killing blow. On success, they take half as much damage. The creatures must be within one hundred feet of each other.

Tier_2.name: Rebuke Spell
Tier_2.description: When an enemy successfully casts a spell, make an Inner Fire check against their Resistance. On success, they also suffer the effects of their spell if it was negative, or you also gain the benefits if it was positive.

Tier_2.name: Lift
Tier_2.description: Concentrate on up to three targets to cause them to lift into the air.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against your targets' Resistance or cause them to be hoisted ten feet in the air and Grappled.
effect.save: The spell's victims may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

Tier_3.name: Sorris' Decay
Tier_3.description: Your outstretched hand beckons forth the essence of the abyss, a roiling tide of inky darkness. Like a dragon's breath, decay bursts forward, washing over everyone in a cone before you.

effect.description: Make an Inner Fire check against your targets' Resistance. On success, they take full damage and begin to Rot. On failure, they take half damage.

Tier_3.name: Torugar the Many Tongued Demon
Tier_3.description: A black wind howls as you summon a pit housing Torugar, an ancient demon from the Abyss. Each turn, 1d6 pitch-black tongues (max 6) writhe forth from the pit and attempt to grapple an individual within the spell's radius. For these grapples, make an Inner Fire check against the target's Resistance. Torugar does not distinguish friend from foe. If a tongue takes 25 damage on a single turn, it releases its grapple and returns to the pit. Each turn an enemy is grappled by a tongue, it takes damage and is pulled 2d4 spaces towards the pit.

effect.description: Anyone who enters the pit is transported to Torugar's Realm, deep within the sixth layer of the Abyss.

Tier_3.name: Reclaim Soul
Tier_3.description: Prepare the body of someone who has died within the past week. Scrawl runes on their flesh to mark them as a conduit to the realm beyond. Find the location of their soul using a tuning fork. Once you've found it, place a soul gem on their chest, and reach beyond the divide. Roll 1d20. If the result is 11 or higher, reclaim the target's soul and return them to life. On failure, something else returns and takes up residence in the body.
Tier_3.upcast: If someone who loved the deceased dearly helps you, they may spend one action point to to grant you advantage on your check.

Tier_3.name: Open Rift
Tier_3.description: Tear a rift in the fabric of reality. Anyone who jumps through is transported to a location of your choosing within 100 miles. If you have visited the location, you are able to open the rift with no trouble. If not, roll an intelligence check with the Grand Poohbah to determine where the rift lets out. Whenever this spell is cast, roll 1d10. On a 1, something comes out of the rift.

Tier_3.name: Astral Prison
Tier_3.description: Subdue a creature and restrain them with magic. Using a void prism, create a pocket dimension which overlaps the material realm. Spend an hour crafting oblivion shackles and bind them to the creature. As you bind them to the creature, speak an omen which will reasonably occur. The creature is bound within the spell's radius until it is dispelled or the omen occurs. No action taken by the bound creature may free them.
Tier_3.upcast: By spending three more action points and using a void catalyst (10,000 gold) you can reduce the casting time of this and cast it on an unrestrained creature. For the duration, you must spend an Offhand Action each turn to make an Inner Fire check against your target's Resistance. On 3 successes, they are bound.
